meanings.definition: To have doubts or reservations about something.
meanings.sent1: She dauts her decision to go to the party.
meanings.sent2: I always dauts before making big choices.
meanings.sent3: Even her cat dauts whether to chase the mouse or take a nap.
meanings.sent4: His dauts circled around his mind like a flock of confused birds.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds of uncertainty dauts over her thoughts.

meanings.sent1: He dauts at the edge of the diving board.
meanings.sent2: The child dauts before crossing the busy street.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel dauts before deciding which acorn to take.
meanings.sent4: Her heart dauts like a hesitant butterfly in her chest.
meanings.sent5: The flickering candlelight dauts in the drafty room.

meanings.sent1: The detective dauts the suspect's alibi.
meanings.sent2: Students often dauts the information presented in class.
meanings.sent3: The cat dauts the authority of the new puppy in the house.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes dauts the validity of his excuse.
meanings.sent5: The warrior dauts the strength of his opponent before the battle.
